events.title: Birth of Albert Einstein
events.description: Albert Einstein, the theoretical physicist renowned for the theory of relativity, was born in Ulm, Germany.
events.significance: Einstein's work revolutionized modern physics and profoundly influenced the scientific understanding of space, time, and energy.

events.title: Trial of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg
events.description: The Rosenbergs were convicted of espionage for allegedly passing atomic secrets to the Soviet Union.
events.significance: Their trial and subsequent execution became iconic during the Cold War, highlighting fears of communism and espionage.

events.title: Death of Stephen Hawking
events.description: Famed theoretical physicist Stephen Hawking passed away at the age of 76, known for his contributions to cosmology and black hole physics.
events.significance: Hawking's work advanced understanding of the universe and brought science to a global audience.

events.title: First Successful Telephone Call by Alexander Graham Bell
events.description: Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful variable resistance telephone call in Boston, demonstrating a key improvement in telephony.
events.significance: This innovation was crucial in making telephone communication practical and reliable, impacting global communication.
